alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 6:26PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT HASKELL COUNTY THROUGH 715 PM CDT... At 626 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Haskell, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Haskell, Stamford, Rule, Rochester, Weinert, O`Brien, Irby, Paint Creek, Sagerton, Lake Stamford Marina, Us-277 Near The Haskell- Knox County Line, Jud, and Us-380 Near The Haskell- Stonewall County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Texas.
